clinical_study.brief_title: Glycemic and Insulinemic Response With Different Sources of Soluble Fiber in Patients Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Plasma Glucose and Insulin Responses After Consumption of Breakfasts With Different Sources of Soluble Fiber in Type 2 Diabetes Patients: a Randomized Crossover Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

collaborator.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul
Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior.

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the acute effect of soluble fiber intake from foods or supplement after a common meal on postprandial plasma glucose and insulin in patients with type 2 diabetes. The hypothesis is a meal with a high content of soluble fiber from food determines glycemic and insulinemic response similar to a meal with a high content of soluble fiber from supplement sources.

detailed_description.textblock: Three breakfasts (high amount of fiber from diet food sources - HFD, high amount of soluble fiber from guar gum supplement - HFS and usual amount of fiber -UF), isocaloric and similar distribution of carbohydrates, proteins and lipids, the order of breakfasts randomly determined. Meals HFD and HFS have the same amount of fiber from different sources, origin in food and supplement respectively. Meal UF consist of the same foods meal HFS, but without the use of soluble fiber supplement and white bread instead of rye bread (low fiber content in relation to meals HFD and HFS). The supplement (Sachet 5g - Fiber Mais ®: 60% guar gum and 40% inulin) will be added to the plain water to meal HFD.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC 0-180min) for glycemic and insulinemic responses
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial meal A, B and C and 30, 60,120,180 minutes postmeal

arm_group.arm_group_label: HFD Meal: high fiber from food
arm_group.description: HFD Meal: high amount of fiber from diet food sources (total fiber 9.7g; soluble fiber 5.4g)

arm_group.arm_group_label: HFS Meal: High fiber from supplement
arm_group.description: HFS Meal: high amount of soluble fiber from guar gum supplement (HFS; total fiber 9.1g; soluble fiber 5.4g) - Fiber Mais, Nestlé

arm_group.arm_group_label: UF Meal: usual amount of fiber
arm_group.description: UF Meal: usual amount of fiber (total fiber 2.4g; soluble fiber 0.8g)

intervention.intervention_name: HFD Meal: High fiber from food
intervention.description: High amount of fiber from diet food sources (HFD; total fiber 9.7g; soluble fiber 5.4g)
intervention.arm_group_label: HFD Meal: high fiber from food

intervention.intervention_name: HFS Meal: High fiber from supplement
intervention.description: High amount of soluble fiber from guar gum supplement (HFS; total fiber 9.1g; soluble fiber 5.4g) - sachet 5 g Fiber Mais, Nestlé Brasil, São Paulo, BR
intervention.arm_group_label: HFS Meal: High fiber from supplement

intervention.intervention_name: UF Meal: usual amount of fiber
intervention.description: Usual amount of fiber (UF; total fiber 2.4g; soluble fiber 0.8g)
intervention.arm_group_label: UF Meal: usual amount of fiber

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with type 2 diabetes
- Body Mass Index (BMI) <= 35 kg / m²
- Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) <= 9%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serum creatinine >2.0 mg/dL
- Digestive diseases (e.g. malabsorption)
- Severe autonomic neuropathy (presence of symptomatic postural hypotension, gastroparesis, diabetic diarrhea)
- Recent cardiovascular event
- Cachexia
- Psychiatric disorder with impairment of understanding
- Participating in other research protocol

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre
